question: It is true that an Operating System (OS) acts as an interface between the user and the computer hardware.
It is false that an Operating System is a hardware component of a computer.
Windows, macOS, and Linux are examples of operating systems.
It is false that Android and iOS are types of desktop operating systems.
The kernel is the core component of an operating system that interacts directly with hardware.
It is false that the user directly interacts with the kernel in a typical OS setup.
Process Management ensures that multiple processes run efficiently on a system.
It is false that memory management only deals with permanent storage like hard drives.
A file system helps in organizing and retrieving files on storage devices.
It is false that the OS has no role in managing input and output devices like keyboards and printers.
A graphical user interface (GUI) is a visual way for users to interact with an OS.
It is false that a command-line interface (CLI) does not allow users to interact with an OS.
Program management in an OS is responsible for loading, running, and closing programs.
It is false that resource management in an OS does not allocate CPU time to different processes.
Security and protection in an OS help prevent unauthorized access and cyber threats.
It is false that an OS does not provide password protection or encryption mechanisms.
The user view of an OS focuses on how easy it is for users to interact with the system.
It is false that the system view of an OS does not consider hardware management.
Batch operating systems execute jobs in groups without user interaction during execution.
It is false that multi-programmed operating systems allow only one program to run at a time.
Time-sharing operating systems allow multiple users to share system resources simultaneously.
It is false that multiprocessor systems use a single CPU to execute tasks.
Distributed operating systems connect multiple computers to work together as a single system.
It is false that real-time operating systems are not used in critical applications like medical devices and flight control.
Android is an example of a mobile operating system.
It is false that iOS is a desktop operating system.
The OS is responsible for process scheduling to ensure smooth execution of multiple tasks.
It is false that the file system management component of an OS is only required for cloud storage.
Security in an OS helps prevent unauthorized access to system resources.
It is false that every OS must have a graphical user interface (GUI).
Device management in an OS ensures efficient communication between hardware and software.
It is false that an OS cannot run multiple applications at the same time.
